column4: Hi everyone.  I need some help.  I just did the ubuntu updates and now my system won't shut down anymore.  It just goes to a blank screen and stays there.
Any ideas on this:  I just did the ubuntu updates and now my system won't shut down anymore.  It just goes to a blank screen and stays there.
can you get to a terminal prompt? (e.g., ctl-alt-f1) ?
should I go to the terminal prompt after I hit shutdown and it goes to the blank screen, or just right now while everything is running?
I was thinking that you might just want to shutdown -r (restart the computer) and see if it is stable when it comes back up ... that may not be best idea though; I'm a n00b
I did a "hard" restart by pushing the power button :-(, Nothing changed though.
what did you update?
Does anyone have any ideas on how to diagnose this issue:  I just did the ubuntu updates and now my system won't shut down anymore.  It just goes to a blank screen and stays there.
I just clicked that orange button at the top of the screen
I don't trust those system updates too much.  One time it broke my xorg
was the update succesful? were there any error messages, anything out of the ordinary?
I don't think I saw any special error messages
hm. chiefinnovator - have you looked in Synaptic (or the apt tool of your choice) to see if you have any broken packages?
Is there a way to see what the computer is stuck on, that it won't shut down?
I see a command to fix broken packages
are you in Synaptic, chiefinnovator ?
yes, Synaptic.  I just clicked the fix button but nothing seemed to happen
on the left hand side, find and click the Custom Filters button
filter for broken pkgs, chiefinnovator - see if there are any
or check the status line at the bottom of the Synaptic window, chiefinnovator
